meanings: (몇 날) (긍정문) a few days, several days, (의문문) how many days

vlive.korean: 십 며칠만... 십일만 있으면 되나? In 10 something days... Is it only 10 days? 듣기 View video ASTRO : 초콜릿스트로🍫
vlive.english: In 10 something days... Is it only 10 days?

vlive.korean: 여러분 며칠 전에 왔던 그 눈 보셨어요? Did you see it snow a couple of days ago? 듣기 View video NCT : 런쥔이왔어요!!
vlive.english: Did you see it snow a couple of days ago?

vlive.korean: 저희 어머님이 며칠 전에 지난주 토요일인가? A couple of days ago, my mother... Was it last Saturday? 듣기 View video AB6IX : 로센키🌹
vlive.english: A couple of days ago, my mother... Was it last Saturday?

vlive.korean: [며칠 뒤 성호의 개인 작업실에 모인 성균관대 꾼] 일단 비트를 한번 틀어볼까? [GGUN gathered at Seongho's studio] Shall we listen to the beat first? 듣기 View video 내 전공은 힙합(My major is HIPHOP) : Ep 21. 각성해서 나타난 성균관대 꾼!! 서울대 츄플의 위기??!!
vlive.english: [GGUN gathered at Seongho's studio] Shall we listen to the beat first?

vlive.korean: 오늘 며칠이죠? What day is it? 듣기 View video TWICE : 원스응으응

examples.korean: The scandal was in the headlines for several days. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 스캔들은 며칠 동안 신문의 표제를 장식했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The scandal was in the headlines for several days. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Long flights throw my sleeping pattern out of kilter for days. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 나는 장시간 비행기 여행을 하면 며칠 동안 수면 주기가 깨져 버린다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Long flights throw my sleeping pattern out of kilter for days. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: several days’ growth of beard 듣기 Add to Wordbook 며칠 동안 자란 수염 Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: several days’ growth of beard Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: The letter came a few days ago. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그 편지는 며칠 전에 왔다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The letter came a few days ago. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Why not take a few days off? 듣기 Add to Wordbook 며칠 (일을) 쉬시지 그러세요? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Why not take a few days off? Add to Wordbook
